intro: Anthyllis vulneraria subsp. macedonica, commonly known as the Macedonian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant produces small, yellow pea-like flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in dry, calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
